creditline: Gift of funds from Mary and Bob Mersky and the Jane and James Emison Endowment for Native American Art
medium: Acrylic on canvas, with glass beads and artificial sinew inset into painted wood frame
text: A painting with geometric shapes, including squares and triangles in multiple shades of orange, red, blue, greens, and blacks. WHAT WE WANT IS FREE is written in neon colors at the top and upside down at the bottom of the painting. Black and white triangles are present at all four sides of the edge of the painting. The frame is made wood and embellished by multicolored beadwork.
title: WHAT WE WANT IS FREE
